title: 4 Quick Steps to Check When an iPhone Was Last Backed Up

steps.title: Open your iPhone's settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's settings. It's the gray app icon, that contains an image of cogs, and is usually found on one of your home screens. If you can't find it on your home screen, it may be located in a folder labeled Utilities.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap iCloud.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap iCloud . It’s at the top of the fourth section of the Settings menu (beneath "Privacy"). If you’re not already signed into iCloud from your iPhone, enter your Apple ID and password. [1] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 30 March 2021

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Backup.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Backup . It’s at the bottom of the iCloud menu’s fourth section. [2] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 30 March 2021

steps.title: Review the date and time next to “Last Backup.”
steps.content: Review the date and time next to “Last Backup.” The date and time of your last backup are displayed in the line of gray text beneath “Back Up Now.” If your iPhone backed up to iCloud today, only the time will be displayed.
